intro: Cheiranthus lividus, commonly known as the bluish wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is characterized by its dark blue or purple flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Cheiranthus lividus is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
